title: Kam people
summary: The Kam people, officially known in China as Dong people (Chinese: 侗族; pinyin: Dòngzú; endonym: Gaeml, [kɐ́m]), a Kam–Sui people of Southern China, are one of the 56 ethnic groups officially recognized by the People's Republic of China. They are famed for their native-bred Kam Sweet Rice (Chinese: 香禾糯), carpentry skills and unique architecture, in particular a form of covered bridge known as the "wind and rain bridge" (Chinese: 风雨桥). The Kam people live mostly in Eastern Guizhou, Western Hunan and Northern Guangxi in China. Small pockets of Kam speakers are found in Tuyên Quang Province in Vietnam.[1] The Kam people call themselves Kam, Geml, Jeml or Gaelm.[2]
